# GAM error in predicting climate

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(colorspace)
library(patchwork)
```

## Load data

```{r}
error_data = read_csv("data/output/data_gam_comparison_mae.csv")
survey_clim = read_csv("data/output/data_gam_compare_survey_sites.csv")
```

## Plot model error

```{r}
# nest data
error_data = nest(
  error_data,
  data = !c("climvar")
)

forms = distinct(survey_clim, form = forms)

# plot data
plots = map2(
  error_data$data, error_data$climvar,
  function(df, cl) {
    ggplot(df)+
      geom_boxplot(
        aes(
          forms, mae
        )
      )+
      geom_text(
        data = forms,
        aes(
          form, median(df$mae),
          label = form
        ),
        angle = 90,
        hjust = "inward",
        nudge_x = -0.2,
        fontface = "italic"
      )+
      scale_y_log10()+
      facet_wrap(
        ~season, labeller = label_both
      )+
      theme_grey(base_size = 10)+
      theme(
        strip.background = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_text(
          angle = 90,
          hjust = 0.5
        ),
        axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        panel.border = element_rect(
          fill = NA, colour = "black"
        )
      )+
      labs(
        x = "GAM formula",
        y = "Mean absolute error",
        title = ifelse(
          cl == "ppt", 
          "Precipation",
          "Mean temperature"
        )
      )
  })

plots = wrap_plots(
  plots, ncol = 1
) +
  plot_annotation(
    tag_levels = "A"
  ) &
  theme(
    plot.tag = element_text(
      face = "bold"
    )
  )

ggsave(
  plots, filename = "figures/fig_compare_models_general.png"
)
```

## Compare climate predictions at survey sites

```{r}
plot = ggplot(survey_clim)+
  geom_abline(
    slope = 1
  )+
  geom_point(
    aes(bioclim_val, pred_val,
        col = forms)
  )+
  scale_y_continuous(
    trans = "sqrt"
    # trans = ggallin::ssqrt_trans
  )+
  facet_wrap(
    climvar ~ season, scales = "free",
    labeller = labeller(.multi_line = F)
  )+
  theme(
    legend.position = "top",
    panel.border = element_rect(
      fill = NA, colour = "black"
    )
  )+
  labs(
    colur = "Model"
  )

ggsave(
  plot,
  filename = "figures/fig_survey_site_model_comparison.png"
)
```
